column1: Art Institute of Chicago////Since I have seen much of the main collection before
column2: and Sunday afternoons are especially teeming with tourists
column3: I chose to check out the great collection of paper weights in the lower level. It's easy to find
column5: dudes! The art of the paper weight predates to the Egyptians and was perfected by the French. Mais
column6: oui! There's a nice little case showing each step of the process. Who uses paper weights these days? Who even uses paper? I liked the colorful depictions of flowers and snakes. It's kind of like the coral reef of the Art Institute
column7: deep below the surface lie beautiful things!
